div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, October 15, 1915
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
October 15, 1915.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
Your accounts for expenses incurred during the period
August 1--28, 1915, in amount $127.88, and during the
period September 8--24, 1915, in amount $176.58, are re-
turned.

On account of the fact that the account for August
contains a number of items that may be objected to by
the accounting officers of the Department, you should
prepare a new voucher in accordance with the notations
on the bill returned.

A new account should be prepared for the period
September 8--24, 1915, ommitting the charges for hos-
pital treatment and making such changes as are noted
on the voucher herewith returned.

The matter of payment for the expenses during the
time you were under treatment at St. Vincent's Hospital,
Birmingham, Alabama, is under consideration by the Bureau,
--2--
and a voucher for payment to the Hospital will be pre-
pared as provided by the Service Regulations, and the
hospital will be instructed to refund to you the amount
paid.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, W G Stimpson
Acting Surgeon-General.
